H0.text: The nervous system transferred Zach’s observations of sights, smells, and sounds from his senses to his brain while he walked through the woods on a class field trip.

H1.text: The digestive system transferred the observations from Zach’s senses—sights, smells, and sounds—during his walk through the woods on a class field trip to his brain.

H2.text: The circulatory system transferred the observations from Zach’s senses—sights, smells, and sounds—to his brain during his walk through the woods on a class field trip.

H3.text: The respiratory system transferred the observations from Zach's senses to his brain while he walked through the woods, noting the sights, smells, and sounds.

A4.text: The nervous system detects environmental changes that impact the body, then works in tandem with the endocrine system to respond to such events.

A5.text: Nerves that transmit information from the body to the CNS are called sensory nerves (afferent).
